org.jsimpledb

Class JTransaction

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jsimpledb.JTransaction
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SnapshotJTransaction

    public class JTransaction
extends Object
    A transaction associated with a JSimpleDB instance.

    Commonly used methods in this class can be divided into the following categories:

    Transaction Meta-Data

    • getJSimpleDB() - Get the associated JSimpleDB instance
    • getTransaction() - Get the core API Transaction underlying this instance

    Transaction Lifecycle

    • commit() - Commit transaction
    • rollback() - Roll back transaction
    • getCurrent() - Get the JTransaction instance associated with the current thread
    • setCurrent() - Set the JTransaction instance associated with the current thread
    • isValid() - Test transaction validity

    Object Access

    • getJObject() - Get the Java model object corresponding to a specific database object ID
    • create() - Create a new database object
    • getAll() - Get all database objects that are instances of a given Java type
    • queryVersion() - Get database objects grouped according to their schema versions

    Validation

    • validate() - Validate all objects in the validation queue
    • resetValidationQueue() - Clear the validation queue

    Index Queries

    • queryIndex() - Access any indexed field's index for containing objects
    • queryListFieldEntries() - Access an indexed list field's index for ListIndexEntrys
    • queryMapFieldKeyEntries() - Access an indexed map field's key index for MapKeyIndexEntrys
    • queryMapFieldKeyEntries() - Access an indexed map field's value index for MapValueIndexEntrys

    Reference Inversion

    • invertReferencePath() - Find all objects that refer to any element in a given set of objects through a specified reference path

    Snapshot Transactions

    • getSnapshotTransaction() - Get the default SnapshotJTransaction
    • copyTo() - Copy an object and its related objects into another transaction
    • copyTo() - Copy explicitly specified objects into another transaction

    Lower Layer Access

    • getKey() - Get the KVDatabase key prefix for a specific object
    • getKey() - Get the KVDatabase key for a specific field in a specific object

    The remaining methods in this class are normally only used by generated Java model object subclasses. Instead of using these methods directly, using the appropriately annotated Java model object method or JObject interface method is recommended.

    Java Model Object Methods

    • readSimpleField() - Read the value of a simple field
    • writeSimpleField() - Write the value of a simple field
    • readCounterField() - Access a Counter field
    • readSetField() - Access a set field
    • readListField() - Access a list field
    • readMapField() - Access a map field
    • querySimpleField() - Query a simple field index by storage ID
    • queryListFieldEntries() - Query a list field entry index by storage ID
    • queryMapFieldKeyEntries() - Query a map field key entry index by storage ID
    • queryMapFieldKeyEntries() - Query a map field value entry index by storage ID

    JObject Methods

    • delete() - Delete an object from this transaction
    • exists() - Test whether an object exists in this transaction
    • recreate() - Recreate an object in this transaction
    • revalidate() - Add an object to the validation queue
    • getSchemaVersion() - Get this schema version of an object
    • updateSchemaVersion() - Update an object's schema version

        public NavigableMap<Integer,NavigableSet<JObject>> queryVersion(Class<?> type)

        Parameters:
        type - type restriction for the returned objects, or null to not restrict indexed object type

      • getKey

        public byte[] getKey(JObject jobj)
        Get the byte[] key in the underlying key/value store corresponding to the specified object.

        Notes:

        • Objects utilize mutiple keys; the return value is the common prefix of all such keys.
        • The KVDatabase should not be modified directly, otherwise behavior is undefined

        Parameters:
        jobj - Java model object
        Returns:
        the KVDatabase key corresponding to jobj
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if jobj is null

      • getKey

        public byte[] getKey(JObject jobj,
            String fieldName)
        Get the byte[] key in the underlying key/value store corresponding to the specified field in the specified object.

        Notes:

        • Complex fields utilize mutiple keys; the return value is the common prefix of all such keys.
        • The KVDatabase should not be modified directly, otherwise behavior is undefined

        Parameters:
        jobj - Java model object
        fieldName - the name of a field in jobj's type
        Returns:
        the KVDatabase key of the field in the specified object
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if jobj does not contain the specified field
        IllegalArgumentException - if fieldName is otherwise invalid
        IllegalArgumentException - if either parameter is null

      • getSnapshotTransaction

        public SnapshotJTransaction getSnapshotTransaction()
        Get the default SnapshotJTransaction associated with this instance.

        The default SnapshotJTransaction uses ValidationMode.MANUAL.

        See Also:
        JObject.copyOut()

      • copyTo

        public JObject copyTo(JTransaction dest,
             JObject srcObj,
             ObjId dstId,
             String... refPaths)
        Copy the specified object into the specified destination transaction. The destination object will be created if necessary. @OnCreate and @OnChange notifications will be delivered accordingly; however, the annotation must have snapshotTransactions = true.

        Circular references are handled properly: if an object is encountered more than once, it is not copied again. Does nothing if this instance and dest are the same instance and srcId and dstId are the same.

        This instance and dest must be compatible in that for any schema versions encountered, those schema versions must be identical in both transactions.

        Note: if two threads attempt to copy objects between the same two transactions at the same time but in opposite directions, deadlock could result.

        This method is typically only used by generated classes; normally, JObject.copyIn(java.lang.String...), JObject.copyOut(java.lang.String...), or JObject.copyTo(org.jsimpledb.JTransaction, org.jsimpledb.core.ObjId, java.lang.String...) would be used instead.

        Parameters:
        dest - destination transaction
        srcObj - source object
        dstId - target object ID, or null for the object ID of srcObj
        refPaths - zero or more reference paths that refer to additional objects to be copied
        Returns:
        the copied object, i.e., the object having ID dstId in dest
        Throws:
        DeletedObjectException - if srcObj does not exist in this transaction
        SchemaMismatchException - if the schema corresponding to srcObj's object's version is not identical in this instance and dest (as well for any referenced objects)
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction or dest is no longer usable
        ReadOnlyTransactionException - if dest's underlying transaction is set read-only
        IllegalArgumentException - if any path in refPaths is invalid
        IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is null
        See Also:
        JObject.copyTo(), JObject.copyOut(), JObject.copyIn(), copyTo(JTransaction, Iterable)

      • copyTo

        public void copyTo(JTransaction dest,
          Iterable<? extends JObject> jobjs)
        Copy the objects in the specified Iterable into the specified destination transaction. Destination objects will be created if necessary, and @OnCreate and @OnChange notifications will be delivered accordingly; however, the annotation must have snapshotTransactions = true.

        If an object is encountered more than once, it is not copied again. Does nothing if this instance and dest are the same instance.

        This instance and dest must be compatible in that for any schema versions encountered, those schema versions must be identical in both transactions.

        Note: if two threads attempt to copy objects between the same two transactions at the same time but in opposite directions, deadlock could result.

        Parameters:
        dest - destination transaction
        jobjs - Iterable returning the objects to copy; null values are ignored
        Throws:
        DeletedObjectException - if an object in jobjs does not exist in this transaction
        SchemaMismatchException - if the schema version corresponding to an object in jobjs is not identical in this instance and dest
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction or dest is no longer usable
        ReadOnlyTransactionException - if dest's underlying transaction is set read-only
        IllegalArgumentException - if dest or jobjs is null
        See Also:
        copyTo(JTransaction, JObject, ObjId, String[])

      • getJObject

        public JObject getJObject(ObjId id)
        Get the Java model object with the given object ID and whose state derives from this transaction.

        It is guaranteed that for any particular id, the same Java instance will always be returned by this instance. Note: while for any ObjId there is only one globally unique JObject per JSimpleDB, each SnapshotJTransaction maintains its own pool of unique "snapshot" JObjects.

        A non-null object is always returned; however, the corresponding object may not exist in this transaction. If not, attempts to access its fields will throw DeletedObjectException.

        Parameters:
        id - object ID
        Returns:
        Java model object
        Throws:
        UnknownTypeException - if no Java model class corresponding to id exists in the schema associated with this instance's JSimpleDB
        IllegalArgumentException - if id is null
        See Also:
        getJObject(ObjId, Class), getJObject(JObject), JSimpleDB.getJObject()

      • getJObject

        public <T> T getJObject(ObjId id,
               Class<T> type)
        Get the Java model object with the given object ID and whose state derives from this transaction, cast to the given type.
        Parameters:
        id - object ID
        Returns:
        Java model object
        Throws:
        UnknownTypeException - if no Java model class corresponding to id exists in the schema associated with this instance's JSimpleDB
        ClassCastException - if the Java model object does not have type type
        IllegalArgumentException - if id or type is null
        See Also:
        getJObject(ObjId), getJObject(JObject)

      • getJObject

        public <T extends JObject> T getJObject(T jobj)
        Get the Java model object with the same object ID as the given object and whose state derives from this transaction. This method is equivalent to getJObject(jobj.getObjId()) followed by an appropriate cast to type T.
        Parameters:
        jobj - Java model object
        Returns:
        Java model object in this transaction with the same object ID (possibly jobj itself)
        Throws:
        UnknownTypeException - if no Java model class corresponding to jobj's object ID exists in the schema associated with this instance's JSimpleDB
        IllegalArgumentException - if jobj is null
        ClassCastException - if the Java model object in this transaction somehow does not have the same type as jobj
        See Also:
        getJObject(ObjId), getJObject(ObjId, Class)

      • delete

        public boolean delete(JObject jobj)
        Delete the object with the given object ID in this transaction.

        This method is typically only used by generated classes; normally, JObject.delete() would be used instead.

        Parameters:
        jobj - the object to delete
        Returns:
        true if object was found and deleted, false if object was not found
        Throws:
        ReferencedObjectException - if the object is referenced by some other object through a reference field configured for DeleteAction.EXCEPTION
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable
        ReadOnlyTransactionException - if the underlying transaction is set read-only
        NullPointerException - if jobj is null

      • exists

        public boolean exists(JObject jobj)
        Determine whether the object with the given object ID exists in this transaction.

        This method is typically only used by generated classes; normally, JObject.exists() would be used instead.

        Parameters:
        jobj - the object to test for existence
        Returns:
        true if object was found, false if object was not found
        Throws:
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable
        NullPointerException - if jobj is null

      • recreate

        public boolean recreate(JObject jobj)
        Recreate the given instance in this transaction.

        This method is typically only used by generated classes; normally, JObject.recreate() would be used instead.

        Parameters:
        jobj - the object to recreate
        Returns:
        true if the object was recreated, false if the object already existed
        Throws:
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable
        ReadOnlyTransactionException - if the underlying transaction is set read-only
        NullPointerException - if jobj is null

      • revalidate

        public void revalidate(JObject jobj)
        Add the given instance to the validation queue for validation, which will occur either at commit() time or at the next invocation of validate(), whichever occurs first.

        This method is typically only used by generated classes; normally, JObject.revalidate() would be used instead.

        Parameters:
        jobj - the object to revalidate
        Throws:
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable
        IllegalStateException - if transaction commit is already in progress
        DeletedObjectException - if jobj does not exist in this transaction
        NullPointerException - if jobj is null

      • resetValidationQueue

        public void resetValidationQueue()
        Clear the validation queue associated with this transaction. Any previously enqueued objects that have not yet been validated will no longer receive validation.
        Throws:
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable
        IllegalStateException - if transaction commit is already in progress

      • getSchemaVersion

        public int getSchemaVersion(JObject jobj)
        Get this schema version of the specified object. Does not change the object's schema version.

        This method is typically only used by generated classes; normally, JObject.getSchemaVersion() would be used instead.

        Parameters:
        jobj - object whose version to query
        Returns:
        object's schema version
        Throws:
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable
        DeletedObjectException - if jobj does not exist in this transaction
        NullPointerException - if jobj is null

      • updateSchemaVersion

        public boolean updateSchemaVersion(JObject jobj)
        Update the schema version of the specified object, if necessary, so that its version matches the schema version associated with this JSimpleDB.

        If a version change occurs, matching @OnVersionChange methods will be invoked prior to this method returning.

        This method is typically only used by generated classes; normally, JObject.upgrade() would be used instead.

        Parameters:
        jobj - object to update
        Returns:
        true if the object's schema version was changed, false if it was already updated
        Throws:
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable
        DeletedObjectException - if jobj does not exist in this transaction
        ReadOnlyTransactionException - if the underlying transaction is set read-only
        NullPointerException - if jobj is null

      • readSimpleField

        public Object readSimpleField(JObject jobj,
                     int storageId,
                     boolean updateVersion)
        Read a simple field. This returns the value returned by Transaction.readSimpleField() with ObjIds converted into JObjects, etc.

        This method is used by generated @JField getter override methods and not normally invoked directly by user code.

        Parameters:
        jobj - object containing the field
        storageId - storage ID of the JSimpleField
        updateVersion - true to first automatically update the object's schema version, false to not change it
        Returns:
        value of the field in the object
        Throws:
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable
        DeletedObjectException - if jobj does not exist in this transaction
        UnknownFieldException - if no JSimpleField corresponding to storageId exists in the object
        NullPointerException - if jobj is null

      • writeSimpleField

        public void writeSimpleField(JObject jobj,
                    int storageId,
                    Object value,
                    boolean updateVersion)
        Write a simple field. This writes the value via Transaction.writeSimpleField() after converting JObjects into ObjIds, etc.

        This method is used by generated @JField setter override methods and not normally invoked directly by user code.

        Parameters:
        jobj - object containing the field
        storageId - storage ID of the JSimpleField
        value - new value for the field
        updateVersion - true to first automatically update the object's schema version, false to not change it
        Throws:
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable
        ReadOnlyTransactionException - if the underlying transaction is set read-only
        DeletedObjectException - if jobj does not exist in this transaction
        UnknownFieldException - if no JSimpleField corresponding to storageId exists in the object
        IllegalArgumentException - if value is not an appropriate value for the field
        NullPointerException - if jobj is null

      • readCounterField

        public Counter readCounterField(JObject jobj,
                       int storageId,
                       boolean updateVersion)
        Read a counter field.

        This method is used by generated @JField getter override methods and not normally invoked directly by user code.

        Parameters:
        jobj - object containing the field
        storageId - storage ID of the JCounterField
        updateVersion - true to first automatically update the object's schema version, false to not change it
        Returns:
        value of the counter in the object
        Throws:
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable
        DeletedObjectException - if jobj does not exist in this transaction
        UnknownFieldException - if no JCounterField corresponding to storageId exists in the object
        NullPointerException - if jobj is null

        UnknownFieldException - if no JSetField corresponding to storageId exists in the object
        NullPointerException - if jobj is null

        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable
        DeletedObjectException - if jobj does not exist in this transaction
        UnknownFieldException - if no JMapField corresponding to storageId exists in the object
        NullPointerException - if jobj is null

      • invertReferencePath

        public <T> NavigableSet<T> invertReferencePath(Class<T> startType,
                                      String path,
                                      Iterable<? extends JObject> targetObjects)
        Find all objects that refer to any object in the given target set through the specified path of references.
        Parameters:
        startType - starting Java type for the path
        path - dot-separated path of one or more reference fields
        targetObjects - target objects
        Returns:
        set of objects that refer to any of the targetObjects via the path from startType
        Throws:
        UnknownFieldException - if path is invalid
        IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is null

      • queryIndex

        public <S,V> NavigableMap<V,NavigableSet<S>> queryIndex(Class<S> startType,
                                               String fieldName,
                                               Class<V> valueType)
        Access an indexed field's index for containing objects.

        This method provides the same functionality as the @IndexQuery annotation with runtime flexibility while still remaining type-safe.

        This method returns an index containing JObjects; for complex fields, additional information associated with the particular index is available via queryListFieldEntries(), queryMapFieldKeyEntries(), and queryMapFieldValueEntries().

        The parameters to this method correspond to an @IndexQuery-annotated method as follows:

        Method Parameter Description @IndexQuery equivalent
        startType Which type of object(s) to search for that contain the field @IndexQuery.startType() property
        fieldName The name of the indexed field @IndexQuery.value() property
        valueType The indexed field's type @IndexQuery method's NavigableMap return type key type

        Parameters:
        startType - type containing the indexed field; may also be any super-type (e.g., an interface type), as long as the specified field is not ambiguous among all sub-types
        fieldName - name of the indexed field; must include sub-field name for complex fields (e.g., "mylist.element", "mymap.key")
        valueType - the Java type corresponding to the field value
        Returns:
        read-only, real-time view of field values mapped to sets of objects having that value in the field
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if valueType is the wrong type for the specified field
        IllegalArgumentException - if startType, fieldName, and/or valueType is invalid
        IllegalArgumentException - if startType, fieldName, or valueType is null
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable
        See Also:
        @IndexQuery

      • queryListFieldEntries

        public <S,V> NavigableMap<V,NavigableSet<ListIndexEntry<S>>> queryListFieldEntries(Class<S> startType,
                                                                          String fieldName,
                                                                          Class<V> valueType)
        Access an indexed list field's index for ListIndexEntrys.

        This method is a variant of queryIndex() that returns information not only about the object containing the list field, but also the index of the value in the list.

        Parameters:
        startType - type containing the indexed field; may also be any super-type (e.g., an interface type), as long as the specified field is not ambiguous among all sub-types
        fieldName - name of the indexed field; must include "element" sub-field name (e.g., "mylist.element")
        valueType - the Java type corresponding to list elements
        Returns:
        read-only, real-time view of list element values mapped to sets of ListIndexEntrys corresponding to all occurrences of the element value in some object's list field
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if startType, fieldName, and/or valueType is invalid
        IllegalArgumentException - if startType, fieldName, or valueType is null
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable

      • queryMapFieldKeyEntries

        public <S,K,V> NavigableMap<K,NavigableSet<MapKeyIndexEntry<S,V>>> queryMapFieldKeyEntries(Class<S> startType,
                                                                                  String fieldName,
                                                                                  Class<K> keyType,
                                                                                  Class<V> valueType)
        Access an indexed map field's index for MapKeyIndexEntrys.

        This method is a variant of queryIndex() that returns information not only about the object containing the map field, but also the value corresponding to the key in the map.

        Parameters:
        startType - type containing the indexed field; may also be any super-type (e.g., an interface type), as long as the specified field is not ambiguous among all sub-types
        fieldName - name of the indexed field; must include "key" sub-field name (e.g., "mymap.key")
        keyType - the Java type corresponding to the map field's key field
        valueType - the Java type corresponding to the map field's value field
        Returns:
        read-only, real-time view of all keys mapped to the sets of MapKeyIndexEntrys corresponding to all occurrences of the key in some object's map field
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if startType, fieldName, keyType and/or valueType is invalid
        IllegalArgumentException - if startType, fieldName, keyType or valueType is null
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable

      • queryMapFieldValueEntries

        public <S,K,V> NavigableMap<V,NavigableSet<MapValueIndexEntry<S,K>>> queryMapFieldValueEntries(Class<S> startType,
                                                                                      String fieldName,
                                                                                      Class<K> keyType,
                                                                                      Class<V> valueType)
        Access an indexed map field's index for MapValueIndexEntrys.

        This method is a variant of queryIndex() that returns information not only about the object containing the map field, but also the key corresponding to the value in the map.

        Parameters:
        startType - type containing the indexed field; may also be any super-type (e.g., an interface type), as long as the specified field is not ambiguous among all sub-types
        fieldName - name of the indexed field; must include "value" sub-field name (e.g., "mymap.value")
        keyType - the Java type corresponding to the map field's key field
        valueType - the Java type corresponding to the map field's value field
        Returns:
        read-only, real-time view of all keys mapped to the sets of MapKeyIndexEntrys corresponding to all occurrences of the key in some object's map field
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if startType, fieldName, keyType and/or valueType is invalid
        IllegalArgumentException - if startType, fieldName, keyType or valueType is null
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable

      • querySimpleField

        public NavigableMap<?,NavigableSet<JObject>> querySimpleField(int storageId,
                                                     Class<?> type)
        Query a simple field index for JObjects by storage ID.

        This returns the map returned by Transaction.querySimpleField(int, int...) with ObjIds converted into JObjects.

        Used by generated @IndexQuery override methods that return index maps whose values are sets of Java model objects (i.e., not other index entry types).

        Parameters:
        storageId - JSimpleField's storage ID
        type - type restriction for the returned objects, or null to not restrict indexed object type
        Returns:
        read-only, real-time view of field values mapped to sets of JObjects with the value in the field
        Throws:
        UnknownFieldException - if no JSimpleField corresponding to storageId exists
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable

      • queryListFieldEntries

        public NavigableMap<?,NavigableSet<ListIndexEntry<?>>> queryListFieldEntries(int storageId,
                                                                    Class<?> type)
        Query a list field index for ListIndexEntrys by storage ID.

        This returns the map returned by Transaction.queryListFieldEntries(int, int...) with ListIndexEntrys converted into ListIndexEntrys.

        Used by generated @IndexQuery override methods that return index maps whose values are sets of ListIndexEntrys.

        Parameters:
        storageId - JListField's storage ID
        type - type restriction for the returned objects, or null to not restrict indexed object type
        Returns:
        read-only, real-time view of list element values mapped to sets of ListIndexEntrys
        Throws:
        UnknownFieldException - if no JListField field corresponding to storageId exists
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable

      • queryMapFieldKeyEntries

        public NavigableMap<?,NavigableSet<MapKeyIndexEntry<?,?>>> queryMapFieldKeyEntries(int storageId,
                                                                          Class<?> type)
        Query a map field key index for MapKeyIndexEntrys by storage ID.

        This returns the map returned by Transaction.queryMapFieldKeyEntries(int, int...) with MapKeyIndexEntrys converted into MapKeyIndexEntrys.

        Used by generated @IndexQuery override methods that return index maps whose values are sets of MapKeyIndexEntrys.

        Parameters:
        storageId - JMapField's storage ID
        type - type restriction for the returned objects, or null to not restrict indexed object type
        Returns:
        read-only, real-time view of map key values mapped to sets of MapKeyIndexEntrys
        Throws:
        UnknownFieldException - if no JMapField field corresponding to storageId exists
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable

      • queryMapFieldValueEntries

        public NavigableMap<?,NavigableSet<MapValueIndexEntry<?,?>>> queryMapFieldValueEntries(int storageId,
                                                                              Class<?> type)
        Query a map field value index for MapValueIndexEntrys by storage ID.

        This returns the map returned by Transaction.queryMapFieldValueEntries(int, int...) with MapValueIndexEntrys converted into MapValueIndexEntrys.

        Used by generated @IndexQuery override methods that return index maps whose values are sets of MapValueIndexEntrys.

        Parameters:
        storageId - JMapField's storage ID
        type - type restriction for the returned objects, or null to not restrict indexed object type
        Returns:
        read-only, real-time view of map values mapped to sets of MapValueIndexEntrys
        Throws:
        UnknownFieldException - if no JMapField field corresponding to storageId exists
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable

      • commit

        public void commit()
        Commit this transaction.

        Prior to actual commit, if this transaction was created with a validation mode other than ValidationMode.DISABLED, validation of outstanding objects in the validation queue is performed.

        If a ValidationException is thrown, the transaction is no longer usable. To perform validation and leave the transaction open, invoke validate() prior to commit.

        Throws:
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable
        RetryTransactionException - from KVTransaction.commit()
        ValidationException - if a validation error is detected
        IllegalStateException - if this method is invoked re-entrantly from within a validation check

      • rollback

        public void rollback()
        Roll back this transaction.
        Throws:
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Determine whether this transaction is still usable.
        See Also:
        Transaction.isValid()

      • validate

        public void validate()
        Perform validation checks on all objects currently in the validation queue. This method may be called at any time prior to commit() to process and clear the queue of validatable objects.

        If validation fails, validation stops, all remaining unvalidated objects are left on the validation queue, and a ValidationException is thrown. The transaction will remain usable.

        Note: if the this transaction was created with ValidationMode.DISABLED, then this method does nothing.

        Throws:
        RetryTransactionException - from KVTransaction.commit()
        ValidationException - if a validation error is detected
        IllegalStateException - if transaction commit is already in progress
        StaleTransactionException - if this transaction is no longer usable
        See Also:
        JObject.revalidate()

      • performAction

        public void performAction(Runnable action)
        Invoke the given Runnable with this instance as the current transaction.

        If another instance is currently associated with the current thread, it is set aside for the duration of action's execution, and then restored when action is complete.

        Parameters:
        action - action to perform
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if action is null
